short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Direct referral of searches to the destination site!

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
"this-is-it" is a Chrome extension used for Google search

Extension activity: The extension directs the user to the relevant site without having to go through the search page
How to use the extension?
After installing the extension,
Each time you search for a value that is an agreed expression for a particular site (as defined in our database), you will be automatically redirected to that site
For example, when searching for the word "fiverr" - you will be immediately redirected to https://www.fiverr.com/
However, you have the option to unsubscribe from any site,
how?
After searching for a set value, as soon as you are taken to the relevant site, you will see a "This is not it" button (top right), clicking on it will indicate that you do not want to be automatically redirected to this site,
And there will be no more automated referrals to this site
You can also choose sites that will receive a direct referral for you
For example, you can choose that every time you write the word "bank" - you will be automatically redirected to the "bank of america" ​​website (https://www.bankofamerica.com/)
how?
After each search, and after you are taken to the site you choose, you will see a "This is it" button, clicking on it will set a direct link to this site for this keyword that was used for the search.
(You can turn off this setting at any time by clicking the "This is not it" button)
That is, if for the search for the word "bank" I select the third entry and after entering the site I click on "this is it", the current site will have a direct reference for the keyword "bank"
